subject: Nutrition
title: Vitamin A and Vision
description: A short lesson to help you apply Vitamin A and Vision.

hook.text: During WWII, Britain claimed carrots gave pilots night vision. It was propaganda hiding radar secrets.

buildup.text: Vitamin A is essential for rhodopsin, the protein in your retina that detects light in darkness.

discovery.text: Without enough vitamin A, rhodopsin breaks down and night blindness develops within weeks.

twist.text: Vitamin A deficiency is the leading cause of preventable childhood blindnessâ€”250,000 cases per year.

climax.text: Golden rice was engineered with beta-carotene, aiming to prevent blindness in developing nations.

punchline.text: The vitamin that saves sight costs pennies.

quiz.question: Why did Britain promote carrots during WWII?
